ref: 9039 *phaṭ2 ʻ cheat ʼ. 2. *phaṭṭ -- 2. [Cf. phaṭā ʻ a cheat ʼ lex. (← NIA. cf. B. below?) and similar meanings s.v. *phakk -- 2; sphaṇṭayati, sphiṇ˚, sphuṇ˚ ʻ mocks ʼ Dhātup.]
K. phar m. ʻ cock and bull story ʼ, phoru m. ʻ ridicule ʼ, pharun ʻ secretly to help oneself to the results of another's success ʼ.
